sentences.english: When Jim died, one of his colleagues telephoned with the news.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆的死訊是他的同事打電話告知的。

sentences.english: He simply fell apart on hearing his son's death.
sentences.chinese: 聽到兒子的死訊，他頹然崩潰了。

sentences.english: The BBC, after all, led its news programmes on his death.
sentences.chinese: BBC可是將新聞節目變成了其死訊中心的。

sentences.english: Hearing the death of her son, Jennifer came apart at the seams.
sentences.chinese: 聽到兒子的死訊，詹妮弗一下子神經失常了。

sentences.english: She was beside herself when she heard of her husband's death.
sentences.chinese: 得悉丈夫的死訊後她悲不自勝。

sentences.english: In the immediate aftermath of his death, the children made a dad-book of photos and drawings.
sentences.chinese: 得知父親的死訊，孩子們做了一本爸爸相冊和畫冊。

sentences.english: We were all pained to hear of his death.
sentences.chinese: 聽到他的死訊，我們都很痛苦。

sentences.english: Many of these people expressed their sadness after hearing of Sager's death.
sentences.chinese: 很多人聽聞他的死訊後都表達了自己的悲痛之情。

sentences.english: Paul had to break the news of her friend’s death to Paula.
sentences.chinese: 鮑爾必須告訴葆拉她朋友的死訊。

sentences.english: On the way he was told of the death of his brother-in-law, Anatole, and of the death of Prince Andrey.
sentences.chinese: 在路上，皮埃爾得知他的內兄和安德烈公爵的死訊。

sentences.english: The following is the most current news about the death of XiaoHei---Ke Shouliang.
sentences.chinese: 下面是有關“小黑”柯受良的死訊。

sentences.english: His sudden death shocked not only those in the film  circles.
sentences.chinese: 謝導的死訊在影視圈內外都引起了軒然大波。

sentences.english: Mary broke bown tearfully when she was told the death of her husband.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗聽到她丈夫的死訊時痛哭流涕。

sentences.english: The news of his death came as a thunderbolt .
sentences.chinese: 他的死訊像一聲霹靂般地傳來。

sentences.english: The news of my father's death came like a bolt form the blue.
sentences.chinese: 我父親的死訊傳來，就像晴天霹靂。

sentences.english: Peng also know the Sue ofs death, she attended the funeral sadly.
sentences.chinese: 彭也知道了蘇達的死訊，她悲哀地參加了葬禮。

definition: to learn of (an event)/to hear about (sth)
Chiang Wei-kuo (1916-1997), adopted son of Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
Zeppelin (name)/Graf Ferdinand von Zeppelin (1838-1917), inventor of the Zeppelin dirigible airship
call in (one's subordinates)/summon (an envoy of a foreign country) to an interview
the critical moment/life and death crisis
on one's deathbed/at the point of death
to have lingering fears/trepidation remaining after a trauma (idiom)
deeply worried and sick at heart (idiom)
